Summary: The Owners took this place down to the studs, they replaced everything, so it has Great water pressure to wash off the sand from the beach. The room we were in had a nice overhead shower with beautiful tile, and the whole room is redone. And, very nicely so.... Now all they need is some nice art work/pictures on the walls, and they will be done. The bedding was great, all the modern electrical & connections for your devices. ( I don't have one) Very close to the ocean, places to eat are nearby, and the staff/owner I met was super friendly. We actually extended our visit by a day because it was so nice, and the price was right for the location. Good Job to the Staff & The Owners on the Quality of the remodel. All the rooms are above street level, so you need to hump up the steps,
Manager Response: We appreciate you reviewing the hotel, unfortunately this is not the correct hotel. I think maybe you are reviewing Surf City Inn which is down the street and recently remodeled.

Summary: Quaint hotel with a style of it's own. Wonderful family atmosphere a short half block to a great beach. Rooms are well equipped with microwave, refrigerator, flat screen TV with great channels, and very good high speed internet. Comfortable bed, plenty of desk and surface space, nice bathroom and closet. The owner is very friendly and will do her best to make sure you enjoy your stay. I moved my son into his new apartment at CSULB and then spent a couple days at the Ocean Surf and Inn Suites to relax before driving back to the NorCal. Very relaxing location with some very nice restaurants and bars within walking distance. Quiet neighborhood even though it is on PCH. The staff keeps the place very clean. I would rate the Ocean Surf and Inn Suites excellent value and I definitely
Manager Response: Thank you so much Don for the kind words. It was a pleasure having you here. Good luck to your son and come visit him often!

Summary: Staff are wonderful, beds are comfy, but wouldn't stay here again. It was a little bit too far from everything and we didn't have a vehicle. Our room had a weird smell, and it was an inside room which had zero privacy. We got switched to a different room, but it was not a huge improvement next time will pay a bit more for a nicer place to hang out
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am sorry you did not like it enough to want to come back but I understand that we are a bit out of the way. Perhaps with a car you would have had a better time. We are not for everyone. The ocean view and the parkview rooms are definitely our favorites since the standard rooms center around the courtyard or face the street. Thank you again for your remarks, I hope someone else that reads this understands where we are at and what kind of a hotel we are.

Summary: We were taking the Kids and Grand kids to Disneyland and wanted some Beach time as well. My wife found the Ocean Surf Inn.  We fell in love with this place upon arrival. We stayed July 7th to the 10th. Debbie is awesome, friendly, just good people. We did Disney one day and the Beach the next. Just steps from the Beach. We enjoyed the Roof Top Deck with a glass of wine, very nice. Very small, comfortable, well kept Jem. Upon leaving I gave Debbie a Hug and promised to return.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your kind words in the review. It was fun having you here and look forward to you coming back. Maybe more relaxation time next time!

Summary Heading: Could Not Be Happier With Our Stay
Summary: I cannot say enough about this little hotel. Immediately when I checked in, I met this wonderful woman (manager? Owner maybe?) and her cute dog. She was beyond helpful and so laid back. I work crazy hours and this was my first vacation of the year - her personality is exactly what I needed. We stayed in the jacuzzi room and it was just perfect. Super comfortable bed, clean, huge jacuzzi and a balcony with ocean view. The sounds of the waves crashing - amazing. We actually kept the balcony door open most of our stay. We are leaving in the morning to travel down the PCH and we wish we would have booked another night here. It's the perfect beach hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. I am glad you had the much needed rest and relaxation. Come back and see us again when you need to decompress or just have fun at the beach.

Summary Heading: Steps to the beach!  Personal touch and the MOST COMFORTABLE BEDS!
Summary: We highly recommend Ocean Surf Inn & Suites!  We were married in Huntington Beach on 7/8/17 and wanted a place where the majority of our family and friends could stay following the reception at the yacht club.  About 6 months in advance I walked into Ocean Surf Inn & Suites and met with Deb Scribner, the owner.  She is very warm and friendly and you can tell the place has a very friendly feel to it.  Ultimately we were able to book about 15-16 rooms for approximately 35 people and even had the Jacuzzi room for my husband and I for 2 nights.  She ensured that those in the wedding party would have their rooms available for early check in so they had time to get ready. Best of all, she gave everyone an AMAZING price!  Keep in mind this is literally with in steps to the beach in the
Manager Response: Thank you so much Karinne for the wonderful review. It was so much fun having your family here. It was our pleasure to make sure everything went off without a hitch. I am already looking forward to seeing you next year.

Summary: We were just in Huntington Beach this past weekend for a wedding.  With the help of Debbie, she put a block of rooms aside for us and helped with getting people squared away.  I think it was like 10 rooms.  BTW - super huge thanks for that.  AAA discount available!  As the date got closer, people decided that they wanted to stay in other areas, other hotels, AirB&B's, etc.   However, my family held true to our reservation, and super glad we did.  This place is the perfect beach hotel.  Open air structure, minimal decor in rooms, lobby filled with beach chairs and toys, a block away from the beach, cool roof top terrace, and customer service beyond expectations.  Did I mention awesome coffee in the lobby to start the day?  Our room was 306, slider to the balcony that offered
Manager Response: It was  such a pleasure having you here. I am glad you took advantage of all the good things at the hotel, although I didn't see any pictures of you boogey boarding! Please come see us again any time.

Summary: Always love this place... best location you can get for such a clean and comfy place to stay. The staff are always nice. The area isf always clean. The room are very roomy and cozy.  The price is very comparably for the location. Nice and not crowded side of the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. We hope you come back again real soon.

Summary: Driving up to the hotel, the outside looked tired and in need of a facelift, contrary to the hotel's website stating it was completely renovated.   Parking was so tight, you would need a subcompact or motorcycle to fit in many of the spots.  When we checked in, we stood waiting for the one employee at the desk to finish a reservation phone call, but she never acknowledged our presence or asked us to wait until she was free. Moreover, even though we arrived after their 3pm check-in time, she was not sure whether the room was ready yet or not. She actually had to leave the office to check on the room, which delayed us even longer.  The room was clean but somewhat tired looking as well. Furniture was noticeably worn. The bathroom sink cold water faucet was broken, but as we were
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconveniences you experienced while you were here. Many things happen during the day and when one person is responsible for all of it I was trying to make sure your room had everything you would need and was in fact clean and ready for you. The website does not show that we have breakfast since that was removed months ago. As stated many places we are sorry we no longer provide breakfast but that was not our decision to make. Hopefully we will be getting that much needed facelift this next winter during the slow season.

Summary: Excellent customer service!  This was a small Inn & Suite giving you that extra special touch, quiet, and very clean.  The room had just the right beach decor and our room had a beautiful view of the ocean.  If you want quiet and away from the crowded beach areas, this is the perfect place.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words Sandy. We're trying to give that "beachy" feel! Come back and see us real soon.

Summary: We absolutely loved our stay! The hotel was quiet, close to the beach, clean, and the employees went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. The best part was they have all the beach toys for the kids to borrow while there! Boogie boards, beach towels, umbrellas, chairs etc. We even checked out and didn't catch our standby flight, went back and asked to use the boogie board for my son until the next flight out, and they said yes! They gave us towels, a card to use to shower and everything we needed for a few hours on the beach for a few hours until the next flight. They were amazing!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. It was a pleasure having you stay with us.

Summary: We stayed here in May before school got out because our residence was getting termite fumigated. It was so peaceful and cute. I really liked the cool gel mattresses for a good night's sleep. The staff was very friendly and the d√©cor was perfect for the beach. It is walking distance to some cute affordable restaurants, all near the water. It is a short block to walk in the neighborhood to the nicest, quiet beach. It is very family friendly, clean and has all the amenities you need to have a fun, beach time - from playing board games on the 1st level courtyard, drinking and watching the sunset from the comfortable rooftop patio, or using the boogie boards and other items they provide for the beach. Though we had to stay away from our residence, it was such a nice getaway for us!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind review. We strive to be family friendly and the perfect small get away. I am glad you took advantage of some of the items we offer such as the board games, etc. Come back and see us again sometime. You don't have to wait to be tented!

Summary Heading: Awesome little gem for family fun
Summary: We wanted a stop where I could show my grandsons the ocean for their first time in California. This place was perfect as we only had one day before our Disneyland venture started. The hotel is small and intimate with friendly professional staff.Parking was free and and there are plenty of places to eat very close by. We had a lovely and spacious room for the day. The price is very fair for the area. We loved the beach toys area where the kids could pick out sand toys and beach towels. Just a very short walk to the beach which was perfect for us. The weather was not too great as it was a cool and windy April day but we all had fun and made great memories. I would definitely stay here the next time I am in the area. It was perfect for what our family was looking for.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We always enjoy the families coming when they are out for the California adventures. Please think of us again if you get this way.

Summary: The location was perfect! Just steps away from the beach with amenities to be able to choose from for the beach. Such as, beach toys, umbrellas, chairs, boogie boards, etc. We stayed in room 306, perfect for the ocean view. The bedroom theme was very welcoming. Anchor & Seashells. TV service was incredible, lots of movies and TV shows to choose from. I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel as it has the best location, views, and very price worthy! I will probably be staying here every time I come to Huntington. :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much Kaitlin for the kind words. I am glad you stayed with us and we look forward to seeing you back here again real soon.

Summary: In case the title didn't describe how I feel, I love this hotel! It is small, quaint, and exactly what I was looking for.  It is literally just across the street and behind a row of house from the ocean.  With an ocean view room, you can see, and hear, the ocean from your room.  You have to know, this is not a luxury hotel, but for us, it was perfect.  It was the price range I could afford and the location I wanted.   The rooms were clean, updated, and how they clean up all that sand is beyond me, but they did!   The people at the front desk, who I have forgotten their names, were wonderful!  They were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help us in any way they could.  We really appreciated the hot chocolate in the lobby on those cold mornings. We loved the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sending in this review. You put it so elegantly how we are not for all people. You are right. We love to have the families here and having the items to borrow is just one way of showing we like kids. It's fun to see who wins (adults or kids) with the board games! I am sorry we were not still serving breakfast but glad you took advantage of the hot chocolate. We are looking forward to you coming back!

Summary: If you're looking for a good location in between LA and sand Diego , this is the spot. The place is cute and just what we needed for a mini vaca. We didn't need to bring chairs and beach towels because they had some in the lobby. The scene is perfect and right by the beach . The main pier is right down the street.  If your looking for a Hilton go to a Hilton if you want cute cozy and convenient come here. We will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you so much Heather for the kind words. We are a small hotel but big on friendly. We will look forward to you visiting us again real soon.

Summary: We chose this place because of the reviews. We're from OHIO and have done the ATLANTIC OCEAN forever.So we came west and were SURPRISED. We felt like home on the Atlantic.Reggie and the staff were GREAT. We like the stay so much that I've already booked a return stay for October of this year.It was my birthday weekend and we enjoyed every minute of it.We will make this an annual trip.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. I am so glad that you found the "west" as inviting as the "east". We look forward to having you come again and again. See you in October.

Summary: Best Birthday ever, Deb made this stay awesome, if you have Children this is the place to stay, we took our 3 Grandsons and Daughter to ocean surf and Deb even told Husband she enjoyed seeing the children going in and out the inn, they have boogie boards pails and everything you could want to enjoy on the beach.        Daughter said the beds are so comfortable she wished hers at home were that comfortable, said it more than once lol.   Again would like to express how family oriented this place is, thank you Deb for EVERYTHING. The Thompsons
Manager Response: It truly was a pleasure having your family here. Tell the boys the shells are in the special shell and I have some in my own treasure jar. Remember, you promised to come back often so I could see those boys grow!

Summary: Looked at different locations throughout the Huntington/Sunset Beach close to where our son lives. Wife and I are definite beach people so this was a consideration in our choice. The room itself was very clean and nicely furnished. Staff was top rate!! Very accommodating to any request that we had.   We utilized their beach chairs and they even provided beach towels for our stay. Extra towels were easily obtained as was anything else we required. We did not have a view but really did not need or want one as we were there mainly to just sleep and shower.  The free breakfast that was advertised no longer come with the rooms. They had quit doing that I guess. Not a big deal as a block away was Starbucks for Coffee and Bagels.   Will definitely stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. I'm glad your son lives close so we will see you more often. It was a pleasure having you here.

Summary Heading: Love this hotel - Our Second Stay
Summary: Located on Pacific Coast Highway on the northern border of Huntington Beach and Sunset Beach, My wife and I looked forward to our return visit to this hotel. Debbie, Reggie and the staff are wonderful and willing to help in any way possible. Great restaurants are nearby and downtown Huntington Beach is only a couple scenic miles down the road. Of course, the beach is just across the street so the location is the big attraction. Sunsets (and even early mornings) are beautiful when viewed from the rooftop patio so pull up a lounge chair and relax!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review Paul. I'm glad you were able to take advantage of our rooftop patio. Come back and see us again soon. The weather is just heating up!

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and just a short walk to the beach. Staff were very nice and accommodating. Hotel was always clean and ample parking space for guests at the back of the hotel. Walking distance to some restaurants. Short 5-10 minutes ride to HB pier or dog beach . Would definitely recommend this to friends who wants to have fun and relaxing vacation by the beach .
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words Marjorie. I am glad you had a good time while you were here and took advantage of the beach and relaxed. Come back and see us again soon.

Summary: We booked a partial ocean view room and were not disappointed. The room was neat, clean, and a bit bigger than I expected. The bathroom was modern. The microwave and refrigerator let us make popcorn and cool our drinks. The balcony had seating for two and offered a partial view of the ocean, as promised. You can also get a better view from the roof.   We were a very short walk from the ocean, though there's a hilly ridge of sand between the hotel and the water, so it might be tricky for those with any sort of limited mobility. It was a bit cold to do anything in the ocean but walk around, but it was neat to see the water and and pick up a few broken shells. We belatedly discovered a shower in the parking area, so you can even clean the sand off before heading back up to your
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. It warms my heart to hear you say it felt like home. That's just the feeling we want to extend here. I hope you come back to see us very soon.

Summary: Deb is a great host! Very helpful and kind. Hotel is adorable and  comfortable. Just steps from the sand and surf, Harbour, and foody restaurants! Lots to walk to and close to other great beach towns and Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so much Anna for the kind words. It's always appreciated when someone takes the time to let us know what we're doing right. I hope to see you back here again real soon.

Summary: I had to quickly book a room for my son and friend whilst visiting family in Huntington Beach Harbour and I was so pleased I put them up in here! It was right after that big rain storm hit the area in late Jan; I had booked two queen beds in standard room but apparently there was some storm damage so they ended up in a king room with ocean view. The bathroom was remodelled, the room was lovely with a very comfy bed and a fabulous view of the ocean from inside and out on the balcony. It was aso very quiet I was told. The other thing I liked about it is it seemed very secure and in a great area. Next time I visit HB, I will definitely stay here in ocean view room for a night or two.
Manager Response: Thank you so much Cathy for reviewing us on tripadvisor. I am glad that we were able to accommodate your son and make sure they had a good trip. Please think of us again if you are in the Sunset Beach area.

Summary: Having formerly lived in the area I had no great expectations as beach hotels are generally very expensive.  This is a hidden gem and I will definitely stay there any time I go back to visit.  The rooms are very clean and bed is very comfortable. It is a non-smoking hotel and that means not even outside in the parking garage!  For someone wanting to just chill at the beach away from the tourist areas, this place is great and very affordable.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. We hope to see you back here very soon. Fun things happening this spring and summer!

Summary: This is a cute, older hotel in a beach community and the staff is very friendly and helpful. However, this place is noisy! If your room is anywhere near the front desk you can hear every conversation going on even with the room door closed. You can hear conversations in the next room because the walls are very thin. There are noisy people coming and going at all hours of the night who have no consideration for other guests. If you plan on getting much sleep at night I would suggest wearing ear plugs. Also the noise from Pacific Coast Highway does not help  either. I was very disappointed with this hotel and will not return.
Manager Response: I am sorry you found our hotel too noisy. Perhaps the solution would have been the ear plugs. I hope you find another hotel that works for you if you come back to southern California.

Summary: Where do I even begin!? When I originally booked this hotel I had booked a suite, well the day we were supposed to fly out we got news that my boyfriend's dad was killed while on vacation. We were so caught up in dealing with that I wasn't able to call until later to cancel the reservation and she was nothing but great about it. By the time we got around to booking the second time it was smooth sailing, Now, we are a law enforcement family, so seeing that most of our run ins with hotels are less than pleasant, we looked FOREVER for a reasonably priced hotel that wasn't going to be a crap-hole. When we got to this this hotel, it did NOT disappoint! Clean, friendly and accommodating staff, and only steps away from the beach!! Parking was a breeze. Our jetted tub wasn't working
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. It always makes my day when I read that people were pleased with our service. We never take that for granted! Thanks again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel right on the beach
Summary: Stayed for one night and found it in a great location right on highway 1 and the beach a few short steps away. Parking is on site, check in was quick and the guy was really friendly. The room was spacious and clean with a view of a bit of ocean too! The Brix Sunset bar nearly next door is also a great place we found serving real ales and good food. Overall I can highly recommend and will definitely stay here again when next on the area.
Manager Response: Thanks so much Shaun. You found one of my favorite spots to eat also. We look forward to you staying with us the next time you are in town.

Summary: This charming little hotel was the perfect base for us to explore the lovely beach towns of Orange County.   Located between the PCH and beach road just north of Huntington Beach, our balcony room gave us a partial view of the gorgeous Pacific, with beach access just steps across the quiet palm tree-lined road.  The Ocean Surf Inn oozes that laid-back, friendly Southern California attitude (we were greeted in the lobby by a Christmas tree decorated with starfish and other sea treasures.)  Our hostess Deb was very personable and helpful - she even gave us a military discount after glancing at my husband's ID without us having to ask.  The hotel was clean, in a safe neighborhood, and rates were extremely reasonable.  Hope we can stay longer next time!
Manager Response: Dear Mrs. Pine,  Thanks for giving us such a wonderful review. It was such a pleasure having you here and I hope you come back again soon.

Summary Heading: A few issues but overall good!
Summary: Great price for the hotel and the room was neat and very nice. The only issue was there was construction going on on our floor and that was pretty loud and obnoxious and when we turned on the jacuzzi in our room, some black stuff came out but it cleared away. The staff was very kind and overall I would recommend it!
Manager Response: I am so sorry that you got caught up in our construction. With this rain we unfortunately had a few rooms get flooded and the repairs were needed immediately. Please check us out again - we should be done by the end of this month! I appreciate the kind words despite the noise.

Summary Heading: Ocean Surf Inn - Nice place to Stay
Summary: We stayed for two nights when visiting Huntington Beach in early November. The place was easy to find. Check in was quick and smooth. The room we got was specious and clean, bed was comfortable. We enjoyed free breakfast on a roof terrace. For our beach stay we could borrow beach towels and beach chairs, which was a great bonus. All in all, this is a very nice and clean place and we can highly recommend that. Thank you.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words. I am glad you enjoyed our rooftop terrace. If you're ever in the Sunset Beach area of Southern California I hope you'll stay with us again.  Sincerely,  Deb

Summary Heading: Just what were looking for and only one street from Sunset Beach.
Summary: Our recent stay at Ocean Surf Inn and Suites was delightful.  We were only one street away from Sunset Beach and the hotel had a great selection of items we could borrow to take to the beach with us including beach chairs and towels, buckets and spades for the kids, balls to play beach volleyball with, bodyboards ect... They also had books you could borrow if you wanted a quiet afternoon of reading and a deck on the roof which was a perfect place to read as well.  A continental style breakfast was provided every morning which had several types of cereal to pick from as well as pancakes plus fresh fruit, juice, coffee and breakfast pastries to choose from. A popcorn machine was also provided in the lobby with different flavored popcorn salts to choose between if you wanted. An
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review. You are right about the doors though. We're working with different manufacturers on how to make that better. If you have any ideas let us know. We'll look forward to you coming back and staying with us again.

Summary Heading: Stayed for a week. Fell in love with Sunset Beach
Summary: This property shows the soul of huntington beach. Friendlyness. Calm. Laid Back.   I stayed for amost a week and the staff was always friendly and helpful  I spent on a room with a view and was not disappointed. Yes. it is a 100 meters from the beach but you can still see the sea and the sunset.   The rooms might be in need of a smaller upgrade but for the price I paid this was an A1 visit.   I hope to be able to return
Manager Response: Thank you Sebastian for your kind words. We are always working to upgrade things at the hotel here so when you come back you will see some of the improvements.

Summary: Was greeted by very friendly staff and got an ocean view room... Very comfortable bed, clean room, and within walking distance of many restaurants and bars. Will stay here again for sure! Love this place
Manager Response: Thanks Jorge for reviewing us. It's always nice to hear we are doing something right. We look forward to welcoming you back. Have a great holiday season.

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in the o.c.
Summary: This is my favorite place to stay when I visit my parents in Orange County. It's close to their home, and a block from a great beach. I love to walk from Sunset to Huntington Beach in the morning, when it's not too crowded and the surfers haven't left yet. The hotel is well finished and furnished and clean and generally quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. It's become a welcome part of my routine when I'm in southern California.
Manager Response: Thank you so much Duane for those kind words. It is always a pleasure to have someone from the community stay here and enjoy it.   Deb

Summary Heading: Nice enough Hotel near the beach.
Summary: I would really give this place 3-4 stars. This Hotel is one block from the beach which is a real plus. We were given a room where we could peek between buildings and see the water. We could definitely hear it which was lovely. There are some really nice touches: buckets and beach gear for children, and there are games and a few books which is nice. Also complementary pop corn although there was very little left when we arrived Some new carpet on the stairs and a wave of a paint brush on a few doors and this place would look a lot more pristine. We appreciated the free parking.
Manager Response: You are right. We are just waiting for the season to wind down a little and outdoor carpeting will be put on all the steps and the hallways. We also have someone that is methodically painting all the doors as soon as people are not in them. Come back after the first of the year and you will see a few new upgrades including a new rooftop deck enclosure.   Deb

Summary: Great hotel and nice people. Location is superior. Right next to a nice beach which was not overcrowded. Everything was clean. Hotel itself had an interesting and fun layout. The internet was a bit difficult to get on but it was free and worked okay once you were on.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words. You're right about the wifi and we are working on a solution for that problem. Hopefully when you come back everything will be up  and running.  Deb

Summary: We loved our stay at the Ocean Surf Inn and Suites! We drove there no problem at all from LAX, and found it easily. Parking was free.  Debbie was super friendly at check in and gave us lots of information and tips about the area.  We often ran into her while coming or going from the hotel, and she always had a friendly smile and word for us!  Our room was nicely appointed, very clean,  and appeared to be recently updated.  There were lots of plugs for charging electronics, coffee in the room, and free wifi which worked fine.  We had a nice little balcony with a couple of chairs that we enjoyed in the evening.  Breakfast was continental style, with lots to choose from.  The sitting area was quite small, but there was a deck on the second floor overlooking the ocean you could eat
Manager Response: Thank you so much Lynn. It was fun to have you here and I am looking forward to you coming back. You'll see changes when you come back so come back soon.  Deb

Summary Heading: Only close to the beach too expensive for what it's offer
Summary: My family stay at this hotel last weekend we stay at a sea view room. This hotel is too expensive for what it's offer. The coffee was terrible breakfast okay just cold breakfast The bed set was dirty we could smell it. Their was hair on the shampoon bottle. The bathroom din't look that clean. I was expecting more for what I pay its close to the beach that's the only reason people stay there. I heard other guest complaining on the COFFEE it was weak and taste bad. How expensive can coffee be for them to buy good quality coffee and hot and cold breakfast. Anyways like I said before its just close to the beach. That's why they take advantage of the price
Manager Response: I am sorry you were unhappy with the hotel when you stayed here. I would like to point out that the breakfast does have HOT pancakes, and no one has ever complained of the coffee to me. If you had said something I could have made another pot and labeled it strong for anyone wanting something with a stronger taste. Or, in the room there are coffee pots with individual packages where you could have used multiple packages to obtain the level of strength. Please, when you visit a hotel and are not pleased, talk to someone. We don't know there are problems unless you bring it to our attention. There were many solutions to the problems you were having including upgrading your room.

Summary: Nice hotel in the process of getting better. Talked with Debbie/part owner and she indicated that further work is being done during the off season. Inside the rooms was very nice with a microwave and a large but compact refrigerator. The staff was very responsive even to having a vase within one minute of our request. Very close to beach being just one street back. Parking is very tight and only for smaller cars. Many good restaurants within walking distance. Very enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review for us. I look forward to having you back so you can see some of those upgrades.  Debbie

Summary Heading: Nice remodeled inn just steps from the beach
Summary: This hotel/innis actually in Sunset Beach a beach frontcommunity acouple of miles north of Huntington Beach.  On a whim we took a daily special to stay at a newly remodeled inn in Sunset Beach, just north of Huntington Beach (Surf City USA) on the Southern California coast. Sunset Beach is a very low key beach community with a great, easily accessible beach.   All rooms are on the 2nd and 3rd floors with a nice sunny patio in the middle of the 2nd floor. Parking is at ground level under the building. And you are about 25 steps from the beach, a short walk along a path between houses along the beach.  Modern clean rooms, nice walk-in showers, basic continental breakfast included with pancakes and cereals as well. One block south is Fish Camp, an outstanding seafood restaurant
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words. It's always so nice to hear that people enjoyed their stay here and also enjoyed the neighborhood. Fish Camp is one of my favorites too! It will be great to have you come back and see the improvements we're making.  Debbie

Summary: It's a stones throw to the beach, clean, affordable and has parking, can't ask for much more! Even better is the walk to Woody's or Harbour House Cafe. It's just too good! The room is large (king), with a good size bathroom. Refrigerator and microwave just in case you need while staying. You never know!! I'd come back again!!!
Manager Response: Thank you Angela for the great review. It's always nice to hear we are doing something right and that you enjoyed the suggestions for neighborhood restaurants. Come back again and see us.  Debbie

Summary Heading: Good Value - Small hotel on the beach
Summary: Great value for money, just off Pacific Coach Highway (very noisy). A cool little hotel with many plus points. Just across from the beach (chairs and towels available from reception), free parking, free breakfast, roof terrace with good quality furniture but seriously needs a repaint as it could be sooo much better. Large rooms with comfy bed, fridge and microwave, table and chairs. Nothing flash but as we just wanted somewhere to lay our heads whilst visiting our daughter in Huntington Beach for two weeks which did not break the bank it worked well.  Tips: Stay in an Ocean view room as much quieter.  Breakfast room is really tiny, only a few bistro tables and chairs and get very busy in the mornings. Great pancake maker and a selection of basic continental breakfast items. We
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words Linda and you are absolutely right that our roof top deck could be so much more. As a matter of fact we are waiting til it slows down a little bit here (so we don't disturb too many guests) and we are going to do the glass/stainless steel surround on the deck. I can't wait for that to happen because I think it is going to be fabulous next summer. Come back so you can see our upgrades as we continue to improve on our hotel.  Sincerely, Deb Scribner, Manager

Summary: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at this location. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The price is always good and the location is perfect. They have beach items you can borrow as well as board games. The breakfast is good and it takes 1 minute to walk to sunset beach. This is one of my favorite hotels.

The staff was amazing and extra accommodating for our family. Our ocean view room was fantastic. The breakfast was good. Perfect for easy access to the ocean. Perfect location for relaxing, laid-back vacation with kiddos.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. We hope you will visit us again real soon.

Summary: It was amazing to be so close to the beach! While Sunset beach isn't quit as pristine as Newport, or Huntington it was so relaxing to be able to listen to the waves crash at night. Our room was comfortable and offered a balcony to sit and listen to the waves. This hotel is also within a 30 minute drive to both Huntington and Newport Beach. I would definitely stay here again.

Quaint. No view as one might expect and the temper pedicure beds are hot for a couple. The staff is friendly and there are good eats close by. Parking was not too difficult. Easier if you have a compact.

Clean, very accommodating staff, free breakfast! Can't beat the location. If I had to nitpick there was no closet or bathtub in my room, and there's not a lot of parking. For the price, I don't consider any of those thing to be a deterrent. I would definitely stay here again!

This is an old-school hotel one block from the beach.  It had a relaxed family-vibe with towels, boogie boards, games, etc available to borrow in the lobby.  There is also a courtyard area with patio table/chairs and a rooftop area with couches, so there are good hang-out locations.  Downside: beds and bedding weren't comfortable. The carpeting felt dirty and the window only opened a few inches so there wasn't really fresh air.  Rooms on the street side are loud with continuous traffic.  This is an area where you spend more outdoor time, but I wish I had felt more comfortable in my room for the price I paid.

Summary Heading: Clean, Basic Accommodations Near the Beach
Summary: My family and I stayed at Ocean Surf Inn & Suites for two nights in June 2016. I learned about the property online and was surprised at the reasonable rate based on its proximity to the beach and compared to the other hotels in the area. I typically stay at moderately priced hotels (Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton Inn, etc.). It‚Äôs been quite a while since I‚Äôve stayed in a motel, but I figured I‚Äôd give it a shot, since the reviews were mostly positive. My experience was mixed.  The Good:  Ocean Surf Inn & Suites is located between the Pacific Coast Highway and a quiet residential street, about a half block from Sunset Beach. The hotel offers a variety of beach toys (pails and shovels, boogie boards, skim boards, etc.), plus beach towels that you can borrow free of charge. Our room on

Summary Heading: Large Room & Bathroom, Continental breakfast & Free Parking
Summary: This small hotel has large rooms, friendly management, continental breakfast, free parking with many places to eat nearby.  A neat place to enjoy the beach and surrounding cities of Long Beach and Huntington Beach

This is my personal lowest level of budget accommodation, clean, convenient to a beach, but sketchy maid service and lousy breakfast.  Good reception staff and lots of loan items available for the beach.

We loved this place! Other hotels in the same price range were blocks away from the beach and had terrible reviews, but this one is a terrific find! It is an easy walk to the beach, separated only by a narrow street and row of small beach houses. I loved the ambience of the place: cute and homey with a laid-back beach vibe. The hallways just have painted cement floors which seemed odd at first but it worked well with the "no-shoes-no-problem" atmosphere. The room was slightly musty smelling, as places near the beach often are, but it was spacious and clean and comfortable. Free wifi and free continental breakfast with the usual offerings plus a cool machine that makes pancakes. There's a rooftop patio with a partial view of the beach and comfortable furniture. The owner/operator

Summary Heading: Warm, friendly, great place to stay!
Summary: We were on the third floor - with 2 queens - clean, friendly, helpful, great little local place to stay! - large community patio with great seats for reading, or resting while watching and listening to the surf.  Cute little areas on 2nd and 3rd floor for reading, snacking.  Great little breakfast - free! - Deb in the front office - very sweet and helpful with everything!  And the local - walking to the surf, restaurants and shops - lots of fun! and just a few minutes from Seal Beach and Huntington beach, Bolsa Chica wetlands and Long Beach attractions.

Summary Heading: Getting better and better every time!
Summary: What an amazing place right on the center of the city! Get a room in the third floor with a nice balcony and with the view of the ocean and you wouldn't regret it, believe me! I love everything about this hotel and now with a new carpets and an attention to the details this hotel is absolute gem! This is my fourth time here but I will return here again and again! Absolutely love it!

This is my fourth time here. Since my last time the hotel rooms got a serious uplift and now have a brand new carpet, ocean themed pictures, pillows, everything is just perfect! I especially adore their rooms on the third floor with the view of the ocean, so spacious and pleasant! Pro's: free parking, Internet, and breakfast. Other pro's: right in the center of everything, such as shopping, restaurants, ocean. Con's: none.

The hotel is welcoming and comfortable. Our rooms were clean and up to date. The lobby has an area which offers beach towels, chairs, and umbrellas.  We walked maybe a half a block to get to the beautiful beach.  Our so lives nearby, so we will be staying here again!

Just a short walk from Sunset Beach (a block or so). Clean, relaxing beach. Starbucks is just cross the main street. Room was clean and comfortable! There was yummy popcorn in the lobby, and towels/toys/chairs/boogie boards to use. This was super convenient and thoughtful. There was also a variety of games. Staff was friendly. It was quiet and relaxing there. I would definitely recommend.

I would give it above average if it was available.  The Inn is on Sunset Beach approximately 6 miles north from Huntington Beach and south of Seal Beach.  Nice quiet location.  The room was comfortable and clean.  Small patio off room with chairs to enjoy time.  Our room (305 I think) was a corner room with a view of the beach and water through the walkway to the Beach.  The Inn had some beach items to borrow.  Simple breakfast available of cereal, fruit and make your own pancakes.

Summary Heading: Ask if they are having any school groups staying
Summary: The beds were very comfortable and the ocean breezes coming in during the evening were so wonderful. But if you go in May or June hoping to spend a morning at the beach prepare for May Gray and June Gloom as per the weatherman. This means cold mornings and the sun doesn't break through til around 2pm. Things were peaceful and relaxing...until..the two school buses pulled up. Then kids were running and screaming down the halls. This was after 10 pm. I called the person at the front desk who said the kids had just gotten back from Lego land and would settle down. Never mind that we had a long day and wanted to be asleep early. There was the constant sound of slamming doors. Got very little sleep. We pay high prices at hotels/motels but can no longer count on sleeping. What are we

Summary Heading: Refurd by a fellow city employee
Summary: They were very pleasant to deal with.  The employee at the front desk to the people that maintained the facility were friendly and professional.  I would stay there again, and recommend to a friend. We also like that this motel is close do some of the best breakfast places in Sunset Beach.

Summary Heading: Very loving hotel in a great location!
Summary: We stayed at lots of motels and hotels on our trip from San Francisco to LA and this was definitely the most nice, loving and likeable one! The location is absolutely great, just next to a beautiful beach and some restaurants & cafes. Especially the hostess Debbie was amazingly sweet and helpful. We felt really comfortable and would love to come again some time!

Summary Heading: Lovely place although expensive and not in Huntington Beach!
Summary: Went straight past this hotel first time as its not actually in Huntington Beach , it's in sunset beach , although only a 5-10 minute drive from there .  Nice big rooms with balconies almost over looking the beach. Got here really late and the receptionist was lovely . Good nights sleep , good selection of channels on TV. There is parking but spots are very tight !

This hotel is a hidden gem! The rooms are large- with modern amenities and the hotel is extremely close to the beach. There's also complimentary parking, wi-fi, and breakfast. In addition, there are several restaurants within walking distance and all of the staff are fantastic!  I highly recommend this hotel! :)

Room with touching ocean view: what else should I expect. Quite lovely setting around the lobby, and a handful board games to choose from. Various options for breakfast.They even provide shaving cream for guys. And super nice staff!

We loved how close we were to the beach. The staff was great. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had an ocean view which kept us off the busy road side of the hotel so we did not have a problem with noise at all. Bed was comfortable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ocean Surf Inn. It was nice to have access to beach toys, chairs, and towels. The one downside was the walls are very thin, and the people next to us were really loud, but that ended around 9 pm, so wasn't a big deal. The breakfast area is tiny, really only one person can be in there at a time, but the selection was great! Seeing the beach from our room was a nice surprise!

Deb you couldn't have been a better hostess I want to thank you for a wonderful time for me and my daughter going to the Long Beach hair show! Comfy beds!!!!. So friendly and they made you feel at home.

Summary Heading: Great location, great service and clean
Summary: Highly recommend this great little hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The price is more than affordable. Sunset beach is literally across the street. There is limited free parking. The staff is very helpful.

This relatively small 3-story hotel was a wonderful discovery for our Christmastime Vacation. Located on the northern border of Huntington Beach on Pacific Coast Highway, a variety of restaurants from seafood to Asian are close by. Downtown Huntington Beach and its famous pier is just a short scenic drive away.   Rooms are very comfortable with a warm d√©cor. The hotel really has more of a Condo feel so it is easy to feel at home. A continental breakfast is available every morning. Warm evenings should be spent on the rooftop terrace. Ocean views abound so it's the perfect place to watch a beautiful California sunset.  The staff was always pleasant and helpful during our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words regarding our hotel. We are glad you enjoyed your stay here and hope you will make us your hotel of choice whenever you are in the Sunset Beach area.

Summary: Booked this based upon other contributor's reviews, surprised by the number of high reviews based on on my experience.  Very disappointed with this place. We had a handicap room, the entire bathroom floor stayed wet during entire stay.  Carpet old and coming up in several spots.  Towels and linens very old and worn out, rooms need to be updated
Manager Response: I am sorry you did not have a pleasant stay while you were at the hotel. We try to move people to rooms that are better suited to them if at all possible. We are in the process of updating several of our rooms and I hope you will give us another chance to show you our hotel at a better time.

Summary Heading: My third time is a sharm
Summary: I've been staying here on and off and really enjoyed my third visit to the Ocean Surf Inn & Suites. A hotel manager, Deb Scribner made everything that was in her power to make my stay the best one ever, thank you, Deb! For those, who aren't aware of the hotel, it's located right between Huntington and Sunset beaches in the short walking distance. Ocean Surf Inn & Suites is also placed right in the center of the city with tons of restaurants and shops nearby, anyways, the location is perfect for all of your activities. The hotel is great for any type of visitor and is perfect for a family getaway. There is a free wi-fi in the hotel which is absolutely amazing! Free parking is also awesome for travelers like me, just as the free breakfast. Plus, a hotel has a rooftop terrace with
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words Vladimir. It is always a pleasure to have you back and staying with us.

Summary: This is my third stay at the Ocean Surf inn and suites and every time my stay here is getting better and better! The place is clean, affordable and located in the center of the city with all its shops, restaurants, as well as the ocean. Best hotel in Huntington/Sunset beach area, guarantee!

Summary Heading: Clean, affordable and close to the beach
Summary: I just finished a business trip to Sunset Beach and stayed 4 nights at this hotel.  It was quite, clean, the beds were comfortable and it was close to everything including the beach!  I would definitely stay here again!

For a local beach hotel you can' t beat it. Very Nice updated rooms with all the amenities of your nicer chain hotels. Nice comfortable beds, flat screen TV with 5 HBO channels, fridge and microwave,  and granite counter tops in the large bathrooms. They even have a free light cotinental breakfast with an automatic pancake machine. They have beach chairs, boogie boards, etc you can borrow for the beach in the lobby. They also have board games and books you can borrow for the kids. Debbie at the front desk was great and took care of anything we needed. This is a great family hotel. It doesn't look like anything special from the outside but you will not be disappointed. Great price and a block off the beach.

This was a surprise as the location is only 50 yards from Sunset beach. Very clean and modern with excellent furnishings and super comfortable bed. Very good value. Safe parking and excellent breakfast.

Summary Heading: Home away from Home, but by the Surf!
Summary: Friendly ownership (not a chain!) tries to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable.  Easy walk to the surf and nearby restaurants and shops.  I would definitely stay again if in the area ( or just wanted a nice place to spend the night!

Summary Heading: One night's stay close to the beach
Summary: We had a bit of a whirlwind trip in Southern California and wanted to be able to spend at least a little time at the beach.  This hotel is one street away from the sand, and we paid a little more to be sure to have a view of the ocean.  Debbie, the manager, was very kind and laid back.  The room was clean and the bed was comfy.  Although the hotel is pretty much on the main drag, there are not a lot of eating options close by.  The beach was great, but be prepared for a LOT of trash on the sand.  I'm assuming it washes up from the ocean, not that locals are dropping trash.  We had a good long walk watching the surfers, which was fun.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and close to the beach
Summary: This is a very good independently owned hotel. We had the deluxe ocean view room. Which had a good size and nice view. The manager/owner is really attentive and takes good care of her guests. You can borrow beach items such as boogie boards and beach chairs. The breakfast room is small, but it is a very good breakfast and you can easily get something there and sit in the courtyard. No it is not the Bellagio but for the price it is a very good hotel. We would go back! Oh yeah with luck you can see dolphins from your room!

We stayed here on the last night of our trip in one of the rooms with a jacuzzi. Coming from a luxury resort in Laguna Beach (@ twice the nightly rate), we were prepared for something of a letdown but were very happily surprised. The rooms seem to be newly updated with tile and stone counters, floors and veneers and were VERY clean. With a small balcony door open, we were able to catch the ocean breeze and, with it shut, the room was nice and quiet (even though the hotel is right on PCH). The staff was very friendly both at check in and out and a walk on the beach was less than 3 minutes away. Definitely a keeper and would gladly stay again if we were in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. It's with reviews like this that keep people coming to stay with us. We appreciate you taking the time to tell others of your experience here.  Sincerely,  Deb Scribner, Manager Ocean Surf Inn

Summary Heading: Quaint, Personable and 50 steps from the Beach
Summary: Get a balcony and you can see the ocean from the hotel. Not right on the beach but the next best thing. Super great location in the heart of Sunset Beach (NOT Huntington...btw) walking distance to just about anywhere from here. Very nice breakfast each morning. Upgraded rooms and parking below. A bit pricey for the age and style of hotel, but location is what you pay for here.

Reading the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor my expectations were high for Ocean Surf Inn & Suites. My expectations were exceeded! We booked for 5 nights. This location is a great starting point to enjoy Sunset Beach and the surrounding area. At check-in Debbie our host greated us, made us feel welcome and did something I have never experienced, she went to our room to make sure it was prepared properly before she accompanied us to that room. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a view of the beach, it was clean, fresh from the remodel and the feeling I got was that the owners were really trying to make the property the best it could be. Beach access is great and a very short walk from our room. The hotel provides some beach towels, boogie boards, beach chairs and assorted beach

We had a family reunion in the area and several family members stayed here.  Debbie was so helpful and friendly.  We loved meeting for breakfast on the terrace. Really enjoyed the proximity to the ocean which we enjoyed many times each day.  Thanks!!

I read what other people have to say here on Trip Advisor.   Prior to a recent trip to SoCal, I was looking for an attractive place to show off the beaches to my wife who is from the Gulf Coast.  Ocean Surf popped up on the radar, I liked what I saw, and booked it.   The hospitality (say hi to Debbie or Jay) was great, the bed was excellent, the room had a partial view of the ocean.  Everything was terrific.   There is a seafood restaurant about a block away, with other choices close.   The beach was clean and uncrowded.   We will come back again. The best way to reward people is to speak out when you are pleased.  Anyone can grumble about something.  So my review is.... 2 thumbs up.  A Gold Star.  A pat on the back.  An attagirl.   This is a hidden gem. and we both liked it a

This is a small property sandwiched between Pacific Coast Highway and a city parking area, making for a lot of traffic noise. First indication of cramped quarters is the parking garage, so tight that several people take two spaces. The room was also cramped, with the closet opening facing the bed instead of the entry area making it not practical for stowing the suitcases. The hotel is old but has been updated somewhat, especially noticeable in bathroom. Mattress is very comfortable, but colors in room are dark, furniture old.  Proximity to the beach is the big attraction here--just walk across the street. Two negative things stand out. The breakfast area is the size of a closet! Two people cannot get coffee at the same time. Breakfast selection is very poor--no protein offered.

The suites were small but inexpensive. Our room had a view of the ocean. The staff was very helpful,the rooms were clean and it included breakfast. Self serve breakfast but it had everything you need. Even had a self serve pancake machine!üëç

Summary Heading: Wanted to love it, but couldn't - Heebie Jeebies!!!!
Summary: The hotel is very cute, I read everyone's reviews prior to staying and was very excited to visit Sunset Beach.  Our experience was hugely disappointing.  Our room smelled strongly of urine and some type of (sickening) floral fragrance used to mask it.  The carpet was crunchy and the pillows on the bed were tiny and lumpy.  We got in kind of late, so I didn't inquire about switching rooms, but I was kicking myself in the morning since I couldn't really sleep with the strong odor, open windows and AC didn't help.  Needless to say, because of the smell and the carpet feel, I was beyond grossed out. Oh yeah, and one of our bath towels had brown stains on it, hair dye, coffee, or who knows? AND, the fire alarm went off at 5:50 am, and there was no direction as to what to do at all.

My family of 4  stayed for 5 nights and it truly gets no better than this place. The hotel is in a great beach location,the beach is right behind the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and have the extras we always need,microwave and mini fridge. All the little extras are so nice,they provide beach towels,sand toys,books,boogie boards,chairs,and beach umbrella for guest to borrow. There is an outdoor shower and on site laundry room. The staff are all so nice and made us feel very welcomed. They put a lot of focus on cleaning which is an important detail. Breakfast is small but it has a good variety. We walked to lunch and dinner plenty of great choices very close. I can't say enough good things about this establishment,it is truly an oasis!

Stayed just one night (Wednesday). Attending a concert & didn't want to drive back to SD that night. The place is easy to miss. Right off of Coast Hwy.  31 rooms.  Parking lot was small. wouldn't want to park there during peak season. Registration area needed A/C....very muggy. The proprietor Debbie ck'd us in. Very polite. Seemed caught up in her own work. Didn't welcome us or smile much. Stayed on the 2nd floor. "Elevator very slow". Take the stairs. Room was very clean with somewhat of an ocean view. Walking distance from the beach. Bed was a king. Very comfortable and nice. Had a good nights sleep.  I recommend!

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in Sunset beach!!!  Definitely will come back!!
Summary: What a jewel in Sunset Beach!  From my first communication with Deb Scribner, the Manager, to the delightful suites, the place is top notch!  Where else can you go and get a fab breakfast:  pancakes, bagels, muffins, pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, cereal, yogurt,orange juice - all included in the price....which by the way was extremely reasonable...$119 per nite + tax..The pancake machine is one of the coolest things I have ever seen!  You just press a button and wait about a minute and it spits out two perfectly round pancakes!  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  You have a mini fridge, a microwave, and in-room coffee maker.  I was on the third floor, and my view from my veranda was the delightful patio below. - which by the way, there is a cooler full of ice with bottled

Great spot - quick walk to beach and really clean.  Debra and everyone at the Inn is super helpful and kind.  Thank you Jay for all of your help.  I would recommend as a affordable beach getaway.   Towels and beach gear provided - lots of little extras that make for an enjoyable stay.  Have been here twice and plan to return :)  Fun bars and restaurants within walking distance.  Free parking.

Drove up from San Diego to Don the Beachcomber for the band concert and stayed one night here.  Receptionist discounted our view room which was not only physically clean but smelled clean too !  Disappointed that we couldn't stay longer, it was that nice.

Whenever we are in the area for work, my co-workers and I choose to stay here. It is a quiet location and conveniently located. I would recommend this to anyone visiting the area either for business or vacation. The staff is friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. The hotel has a personality that reflects the atmosphere of this beach town which makes staying here is much more pleasant than staying at a standard chain hotel.

We've stayed at this Inn twice now because the price is great and we get a nice clean room and friendly service along with it.  It's a few steps from the beach and walking distance to a great Italian restaurant.  We already have our third stay booked here.

Summary Heading: Great staff! Clean room, close to the sand.
Summary: We recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a beach trip, great food and a clean comfortable room.  The hotel is small, but very clean and well managed. The breakfast area is just big enough to serve in, but there is a nice patio on the second floor.  The beds have comfy memory foam, and the bathroom was spotless.  The king rooms are decent sized, with a Samsung HD TV with lots of channels and the WiFi was very swift (great for the teenaged kids).   Sunset Beach's surf can be a little strong during high tide, so make sure you like at the tide guide Deb updates on the surf board in the lobby. There are boogie boards, beach towels and sand pails in the lobby for the kids.  There are several great restaurants within walking distance. Ocean Surf will our vacation beach

We stayed here for two nights with our teenage sons. We were in between vacationing in Vegas and in Disneyland.  Our room was fine however I wish I would have chose a room with a balcony. We loved the quiet location. We liked walking across the street to the beach. There is free breakfast which is nothing fancy but sufficient. Also,they allow you to borrow beach supplies which they have in the lobby such as chairs and boogie boards. That worked out great for us! There are a few restaurants you can walk to. The parking situation for us was tight. But we always managed to find a spot. Overall our location was great. You can get in the car and drive to a few other beach towns which are only a few miles away. If you're looking for a clean place to stay for one or two nights with

This is our second stay here this summer.  We like it a lot.  The staff is super, the lobby is filled with homey touches.  Haven't tried the free breakfast.  There's an elevator and ample parking.  My sister and I have stayed on the second floor, ocean view with two queen beds and on the third floor with ocean view and one king bed.  Both rooms had balconies with table and chairs.  !/2 block from  beach, on the west side of PCH.

I am a big fan of Trip advisor and have been using it for years along with writing a few reviews when I can. My husband and I were on a week's trip down the California coast and were reviewing hotels to stay in and my husband wanted to stay at this hotel as most were full for the evening and the reviews looked good. I do not know how anyone has anything good to say about this hotel! It was probably one of the top 10 worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Here are the Pro's: walking distance to the beach ( although not beach front, nor did we have a view on the 2nd floor as there are a row of homes across the way), balcony (not all hotels have balcony's), refrigerator in the room.  That is it. The rest are all con's : stains on the bed sheets and mattress along with hairs in the

Visited this hotel two days ago. I can honestly say that we cannot wait to go back. The room was great, clean, spacious  and we were on the third floor with a balcony and an amazing view. Check in and check out was quick and their continental breakfast was good. This hotel offers anything you need. I will definitely be back.

Stayed here on a 3 day trip, looked soooo much better than expected. Staff was beyond helpful and friendly! Free breakfast from 7-10am soooooo much food we skipped lunch. Would definitely recommend this for anyone!!!

Summary Heading: Great location friendly staff clean rooms
Summary: I recently stayed at the hotel with my 3 kids. We were in an overflow situation when we visited my friends staying at a house on Sunset Beach. The hotel is the block behind the beach with easy access. There are tons of restaurants within walking distance. They provided a great continental breakfast (very cool pancake machine!) & had available everything you needed at the beach (big towels, chairs, boogie boards, buckets, etc.,). We stayed for a week and planned to stay longer but my friend's mom needed to leave early. They were super understanding & refunded those nights back to us. Free parking and very reasonable rates. I highly recommend it for your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Great value in nice beach location
Summary: Located right at Sunset Beach, this is a very good value.  Sunset is a nice 'locals' beach due to limited public parking.  Also close to popular Huntington and Seal Beach.  Lots of nice restaurants and shopping areas around.  Room was in great shape and very clean.   Front desk folks were helpful. Small parking lot underneath, but plenty of easy street parking.  No noise issues.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place! Pleasantly surprised! MUCH better than expected!
Summary: From the on line photos outside, i just did NOT think i would be very impressed. it was much more modern, clean & larger than i expected. CANNOT BEAT LOCATION!  Literally out door, cross tiny street & WALLAH! there is the beach :)  Parking was FREE & easy in garage. Lady in charge ...  working her butt off, but so pleasant. Its a nice area of Sunset beach, quaint & more quiet, then a 10 min drive or so to Huntington beach downtown. Would certainly stay again! - Oh! i we LOVED the make your own pancake machine! :) Breakfast very impressive!

This is some kind of best kept secret.... Friendly staff, rooftop patio, good views, super comfy bed..... shower is huge! You could hose down a surfboard in there.... bring a smaller vehicle as the parking spots are slender. If you are on a special diet (Gluten free here) bring your own breakfast and snacks.

My husband and I enjoyed our 2 night stay (check in 7/12/15) and was very impressed with Jay who assisted us from the front desk throughout our stay with all our needs and also Debbie for her Management skills.  Room had partial ocean front view (208) and steps away from the beautiful Sunset Beach, roof top terrace for coffee and multiple restaurants within walking distance--never even got in our car!  Very pleasant and wonderful beach retreat for us traveling from San Diego!!

We stayed 2 nights prior to a roller hockey tournament.  If we‚Äôd have known how great the hotel was, we would have spent the entire week here rather than with the rest of the team at the Hyatt Anaheim for the other 4 days. The manager, Debbie, is so sweet and friendly and made the trip perfect.  The beach was great, and not as populated as the area near the Huntington Beach Pier. And the hotel had loaner beach gear!  Less than 10 minute drive to the pier &shops, but hotel area was within walking distance of Captn Jacks for dinner and Mothers for drinks.   The room was clean with one of the most comfortable beds I‚Äôve slept in.  Breakfast was perfect with a pancakes, muffins, cereal, yogurt, fruit.  The room had a microwave and a small refrigerator with freezer and TV had HBO (The

To be honest when we booked this room online we thought it was to good to be true, Free parking, free wifi, super close to the beach and a great price? We just knew there had to be something going on. Then we got there and what we found out what was going on. Awesome service! From the first interaction Between the manager and I to the good bye as we checked out my wife and I had a smile on our face! Great staff helped us with an early check in and in the lobby are all kinds of beach toys and board games for guests to use free of charge. Our room was very clean and nice and a lot larger then we expected most rooms have a private balcony and there is also a sun deck open to all guests. The memory foam style beds were a nice surprise.The free breakfast had more then enough for

Summary Heading: No Frills, But Convenient and Clean
Summary: The room was clean, basic and beds were comfortable.  Close to the beach with not a lot of crazy tourists.  Sunset beach is a much less crowded beach than the main Huntington Beach area.  We had quite a few dolphin sightings!!  If you want a good family place,  this is it.  It you want night clubs, surfing and touristy attractions, go to Huntington Beach.  3rd floor ocean view rooms are nice.  Easy parking. Friendly staff. Free Wifi.  Free breakfast is pretty lame, so bring some back up food!  Overall a good experience.

This is a cute place to stay.  The manager was very friendly and helpful.  She was onsite and able to address any issues if needed. The room was clean, comfortable and the air was ice cold. Free covered parking, close to the beach and several restaurants in walking distance.

Is it a Five Star Hotel? No, but neither is my budget currently.  There has been a lot of work that has been put into this inn, and I take that into consideration from where it was then and now. The complete hospitality and consideration I was given, by Deb and her staff will have me make my way back ASAP! From letting us utilize a cart to take our luggage and cooler upstairs, to having a wine corker, mean a lot to me, because they were very personable.  My jacuzzi bath, and bed, and view of the ocean was terrific! When Deb said we had the best room, I believe her!!! The walls were a bit thin so if one stomped too hard up & down the stairs, or talked a bit too loud, you can hear it, but that's really hard to change with an already built facility.  The breakfast was continental,

This hotel appears to be in the process of upgrading. It is a shirt walk from the beach but does not really have ocean views except from the roof top terrace. Hotel staff were nowhere to be found after we checked in. Room was big but is in need of some cosmetic touch ups. The towel rod was falling off the wall, the sink leaked,and the sheets were rough. The floors all over the hotel were uneven, which made walking difficult.

It's a small hotel located within a few seconds of walking to the beach. We paid for the convenience and location knowing that we weren't getting a four or five star luxury stay. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is nice, the people are even nicer, and the location was fantastic. But it could use some refurbishment, nicer/softer towels, and the balcony railing on our third floor patio was a bit shaky (we wouldn't let our teenaged kids out onto the balcony). They accommodated us with no advanced reservation and welcomed us like they were already expecting us. We even found a great place to eat within a few minutes' walking distance. We would definitely consider staying here again.

i have stayed at this wonderful hotel from May 17 to May 20. A hotel is in the center of everything, very close to the ocean. All hotel's personnel is nice and friendly. I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Definitely a good hotel to stay in to discover the area: Huntington Beach, Laguna Beach, Corona del Mar. All these nice spots are easy to reach by car within 20 minutes.  Sunset Beach is quiet enough to relax perfectly, enjoy the super nice beach just a 2 minute walk from the hotel and relax - after a day in Huntington. The beach is perfect for long walkings, runnings or just relaxing. Absolutely non crowded although super lovely.  Take the Deluxe room with ocean view! Its absolutely worth it to upgrade. The standard room is not that nice. Room is big, bathroom with bath is new and very clean. TV and WLAN all working nicely. Bed is very comfy to sleep well.  Very nice service. Only disadvantage is the included breakfast: rather non healthy quick breakfast (croissant, butter,

I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed.  The location is superb and parking wasn't a problem for me.  The room we had was spacious, clean, and rather quiet.  The bed was freaking comfortable, I stayed in two different hotels before this on during this trip and this was BY FAR the most comfortable bed I slept in!  I was there on Easter Morning and they even put on an "Egg Hunt" for the smaller guests, talk about great customer service!!  My only "Complaint" would be that the shower in the bathroom was only a curtained off area with the shower head pointed sideways which meant water on a good portion of the floor.  There are several "negative" reviews about the breakfast, and while it's not a full breakfast bar at the Hilton it's also good to tide

The hotel is the middle of some upgrades, so the lobby, stairway and elevator look a bit outdated. However, our room had been remodeled and was quite nice. We were on the ocean side of the building, so we had a quiet room. Great location to the beach. Sunset beach was clean and not crowded, we had a great day playing in the surf. The breakfast was basic, coffee, danish, cereal etc.

Spent a week in southern California and what a treat staying at the Ocean Surf..  The beach is a given steps from the Hotel and as walkers we strolled for miles up and down the beach.. Nearby restaurants were very nice with many to choose from. Will definitely be back for another stay.

The Ocean Surf was selected due to the proximity to the beach and that was not disappointing at all.  Our room was spacious and fully acceptable.  Parking was cramped although we always found a spot within a block.  The breakfast room was tiny, really too small to be comfortable, and the breakfast items were very minimally acceptable.  This facility offers no luxury but we thought it was a good value.

Nice room. The shower was lovely. The breakfast was simple and nice. I always had frootloops with milk. There was orange juice, some apples bars, tea, coffee, some croissants and toasts. They dont have any fees if you send packages, be careful because the address is quite tricky and its not recognised by some postal services and GPSs. The parking was good and its free. The location is quite convenient if you want to avoid downtown traffic. There are some cool bars and restaurants near there. I think the best thing was having the beach less than 100 mts away. The lady who cleans the rooms was very kind. I would definitely come back!

This little gem is everything you hope it will be, comfortable, clean and decidedly special.    We appreciated the small size, definitely not a chain hotel, the friendly staff and the large, clean bedroom with a balcony and sea view.   What a treat.   Our room, with microwave and 'frig had been refurbished.   Only comment would be that the breakfast room is way too small and should be addressed.   We took our breakfast to our room as there was a table and two chairs.   We would definitely come back and recommend it to others.

This was our second stay here in 2 months! i couldn't get enough the first visit!, i was elated! I saw this hotel in person and online many times. It resembles a very classy townhouse complex. The new owners have done a tremendous job of remodeling the entire hotel. From the day we first booked this place, i was delighted to speak with Deb, she was very welcoming. The next person i talked to was the owner Devon. He gave us such a great deal! we got a king size room with a handicapped bathroom and a balcony! This hotel is only steps from the beach, unlike most of the hotels in the area which are across PCH, and you can't safely cross this road inbetween lights which are 1/2 mile apart, plus across a very wide road which even a jogger can hardly cross before the light changes.

The hotel overall is fine. Clean nice room, very comfortable bed, mini fridge and microwave. Check in was easy and staff was nice.  Downside is parking is difficult unless you drive a compact. Construction is going on so it is pretty loud as the floors are just concrete in the hallways. The location is good for the beach but not that close to restaurants. I paid for the ocean view room and that was a little funny. You can see a small part off the ocean between two three story beach homes. Not sure if that qualifies as a view. Water in shower has to be adjusted as you go for temp. Just don't expect high end.

Summary Heading: Hotel in heavy reparation and terrible cleaning service!
Summary: It could have been an amazing experience and place to stay. To start it is NOT on the beach but close to the waterfront. The rooms are large, the bed comfortable. But unfortunately, the good points stop there. The hotel was in heavy reparation when we arrived which means our floor was dirty, the tiles were completely off and the workers started very early to be extremely noisy (hammering in front of our door), not the best to have a relaxing stay . The cleaning service was the worst we ever experienced: towels were not replaced, neither shampoo and soap. We had to ask for them twice. Finally, the breakfast "room" aka closet, was very unpractical. The breakfast options were poor too. The owner/manager has a true diamond in the rough with this place, but a poor and lacking service

From the moment I saw pictures of this place, I knew that I had to go there. It took a while to find an open room. In the meantime, I read all of the different reviews for this place. Everyone was saying the same things. First, that the hotel is located in the best spot, being right next to the beach. Everyone commented on the upgrades that are being done to the hotel, some people complaining about the noise from construction, but that was the only complaint other than petty little things like the breakfast area being small, they are already adding extra space for that. I originally booked the hotel through another booking site, but thought better and called the hotel directly. Right away, the person who I spoke with beat the best price on any site, and told me that it was okay

Nice enough for a one night stay. Had to ask for towels; none in room. Bed was comfortable. Short walk to beach. Complimentary breakfast including coffee, fruit, yogurt, cereal, and pastries. Free wi-fi. Free parking. Bathroom had shower cap, make up remover towel, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion.

Very welcoming and comfortable room, great location jjust south of Seal Beach, and close to restaurants, all the amenities, and right near the beach. It is being renovated but that did not affect our stay.

Booked this hotel through them, Has been renovated and still is going through renovation, on a Sunday?  Really, we had worker that started at 8:30 talking, not making a lot of noise but talking and due to no sound guards on the doors or weather striping, we heard it all.  Also if you are close to the open parking area the sound of the street PCH is echoed and loud.  Towel are a lot to be desired for as nice of a place as it is.  The only real complaint is the noise and the towels, other than that for the price it was nice.

I booked this room only a couple of days prior to arrival.  The room was large and comfortable.  It had been recently updated. I always appreciate rooms that have refrigerators and microwaves in them.  The room was quiet and looked toward the coast.
