I wish we had asked for a top floor room, we would have had a better view of the ocean.  I forgot to ask for the WiFI log in information which was suppose to be free, that information is usually given to guests at the time of check in. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were is good shape.  We would stay again if we needed to be in the area.

Summary Heading: Ok for a couple of nights
Summary: Inn has been renovated. Carpets and furnishings looked new. Good beds. Everything was reasonably clean. They just need to pay attention to details. Towels are thin and really need to be replaced. We had to ask for wash clothes and hand towels. Towels are not replaced daily;  nor was the soap or any coffee and supplies. Ok for a couple of nights.  Not a vacation retreat.

Couldn't off asked for anything better. Absolutely perfect. Directly on the beach 5 minute drive to huntigton beach!!! Parking was great! Staff very nice! Would defiantly stay here again. Everyone in the area is really friendly too. Wanting to come back already!!

Our house was doing a major plumbing job so we went up to Ocean Surf Inn for 1 night, about a 30 minute drive from Newport Beach.    I have lived in Orange County for 70 years.   From personal experience this a steal!    Sunset Beach is not the glitz and glamour of Newport, but it is a great little town.    Top level on the ocean side of the Ocean Surf Inn will get you a view of the the Pacific.    The staff is courteous and helpful.    About a 5 minute walk to Sunset Pizza for a killer dinner.

This motel has been purchased by new owners and has been completely renovated.  It is now called The Ocean Surf Inn and Suites.   After booking my stay for Sanatra Inn, I went on yelp and was horrified by the reviews.  I was not planning on staying but decided to at least see for myself how bad it was going to be.  Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised to walk into the lobby and see it looked and smelled like a remodel.  New paint new flooring and nice granite counter at lobby desk.  We checked in and went into our room.  The room was completely renovated.  The carpet was new, the paint fresh, all furniture was new. The bathroom was beautiful with new counter, sink, tub and toilet.  I felt as if I were at a nice hotel. The price is very good too.  Under $200 a night for an

For a place close to the beach, the price is unbeatable, however....if you are looking for a nice place close to the beach..pass this on by. The room was clean from what I could tell, but major renovation is needed. Cupboard doors don't close, the blinds on the sliding glass door to the DIRTY balcony were broken, it was supposed to be a king bed upgrade room...we did get the King bed, but there was a twin bed shoved in there too. Pretty quiet for a Saturday night i early September, but because the blinds were broken the lights from the beach homes that were on all night for security reasons were shining into the room all night.  No one  was on duty in the office, apparently owners are in residence so you have to call them to the desk. Elevator wasn't working, but since it was

The advantage this place has is it's location, the building & rooms are in a bit of disrepair, but it is cheap, and mostly clean. The hallways in the common areas are not super clean, but then, that's not where you sleep. You will find bulbs burned out, loose toilet seats, doors that stick, broken hanging blinds, oddball tv's, but you will get the basics for cheap, plus free wifi. I found this place online looking for something at the beach & for cheap. That's what I got. Would I stay here again? Well, probably not, but, if you are planning to be out all the time and only come back to sleep & shower, and you are say, in your 20s....this place is probably good for you. I say "in your 20s" b/c in that era one is not so fussy about accommodations.

There are not many places to stay in Sunset Beach and this is my favorite. Really close to the beach, a walk to the canals but not too far. Really good value with good management, happy to help. There are,'t many shops nearby so def stop on route for supplies. Good location if you are planning on spending the whole weekend on the beach.

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for the money
Summary: If you are looking for a place to crash and shower while in the Los Angeles area, then look no further. The owner checked us in late and made it a speedy process as we were very tired. The room was cleaned well, the bed was comfortable, and she gave us the room with a balcony with a great view of the ocean. The room had a safe, a microwave, small fridge, dressing table, and a nice new big screen. There was a small rip in the carpet and the bathroom could have used a new shower head. Again, if you don't plan on spending much time in the room, and why would you.....it's a great bargain!!! Oh, and whole you are there, be sure to walk down to the Roman Cucina restaurant!!!

We've stayed with friends and hired two rooms for one week with ocean view. It's very close to the beach. The room was a little bit worn out but clean. There were no bugs and the mattress, blankets were okay. And yes this room was cheap and that's what we wanted because most of the time we were out for surfing and sight seeing. Great value for money and we will definitely return.

Summary Heading: A decent value for a hotel next to a beach
Summary: I stayed in this hotel on three occasions and in three different rooms. The hotel is in great location. It is located in second row from the beach and it is very close to the restaurants and bars in the pleasant community of Sunset beach. The building is older and it is getting a bit worn out, especially the common areas. All rooms I stayed in were generally quite clean. The beds had good mattresses and good clean linen and towels. The bathrooms were good and always clean as well. Each room had balcony, small kitchenette, cable TV..‚Ä¶ However, I was not too thrilled with the shower head as it spays low quantity of water under quite high pressure (a bit odd ‚Äì but not a deal breaker). Also carpet in some of the rooms can be replaced and/or cleaned as well. I have never seen any

To start with its a beautiful place located next to the beach.. not to forget SANATRA INN IS VERY POCKET FRIENDLY . I have been there in april 2011 with my husband . we have been offered with the best they could with the price we paid. My husband being allergic to dust was very concerned about the cleanliness and hygiene, thankx to the management our room was very clean be it the carpet, linen or towels. We really appreciated it as it made our stay very comfortable else my husband would have end up sneezing all night . the manager was very friendly and courteous . ocean view balconies was the place where me and my husband had  a great time together !! i have great memories here ! I WOULD SAY ITS A PLACE YOU CAN HAVE GOOD TIME WITHOUT STRAINING YOUR POCKETS ... THUMBS UP FROM ME

My husband and I have stayed here at least 10 times in the last 10  years. The female manager has always been very nice. But, it has been going downhill over time. Our last trip, we paid 159.00 for the jacuzzi room (it's more like a bath tub). The jets worked maybe 10 minutes. I could not connect to the internet  for the first 3 hours, and after a few calls to the front desk, the problem was solved.  Also, the ice machine didn't work. The paint job is too many different colors to describe...although that has nothing to do with the quality of the stay. Bottom line is we used to love it, but, unless they fix what's broken...we won't be back!!

I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times over the past 5 Years. I would have to say this last time the room was not fit for the homeless. Harsh? Well no, the room had the aroma of Mildew, the A/C screen was so dirty it blew dust when I turned it on. took me 30 minutes to clean it myself. Carpet was, well just bad(Stained, bleached, tattered) I was in a situation where I had no choice all the other Hotels/Motels were booked. I do not know how they can charge more and do less.

Summary Heading: Very Surprised!  And All Pleasant surprises!
Summary: I stayed here alone with my twin daughters, looking for a place to spend Memorial Day weekend where we could be close to the beach, I could work and it b be a peaceful experience.    There was a mixup on my reservation so I had made a reservation with another nearby hotel, thinking I was not confirmed for this one.  The other hotel was the most dreadful experience from the service to the room (talk about embellishment on the advertisement!) to the price (all the extra fees).  It was so bad, that I decided to come and see if by chance there was any opening at the Sanatra Inn      As it turns out my reservation was solid, the manager showed me the room ( as I was a bit gun-shy at this point) and did everything possible to aid in me moviing my daughters in the middle of the night

Summary Heading: We stayed there last summer, and are booking our trip for this summer.
Summary: The reviews from the "100% satisfied" customers sounds fony to me. lol.    We stayed there last summer, and it was exactly what we expected for our $100 a night being walking distance from the beach.  --  It is an older building, so don't expect much.  you truly do get what you pay for.  This is a cheap motel, there is nothing fancy about it.  However, the staff was friendly and helped us with our needs.    We went on a weekend trip (drive there friday, play saturday, drive home sunday).... so with that said, we weren't in our room for much more then sleeping and cleaning up from the beach. -- and for that type of trip, this motel was perfect.  its a place to sleep and store our things.  We didn't see or have any issues with roaches.  the "breakfast" was kind of sad -- a muffin

Summary Heading: One of the best places in Sunset Beach!
Summary: I'm sorry but a lot of the people who seem to give Sanatra Inn a negative review don't seem to understand that this is a motel, and one of the best ones in Sunset Beach. If you are not familiar with the location of Sunset Beach then let me educate you: there are town-homes on the front row of the beach. Quite frankly the location of Sanatra Inn is perfect. Yes there are town-homes in front of it but the views of the ocean are amazing from their balcony.   They provide a mini-fridge and microwave. This is excellent for anyone who wants to save money during their trip, or preserve anything perishable. As for internet they have by far one of the best hi-speed internet service providers in the area-- this is great for those of us who use  notebooks/laptops. The service is friendly.

Summary Heading: Very nice and clean good location
Summary: We stayed at SanatraInn and had very good sleep and enjoyed our 5 days trip. Rooms were clean and had balcony. I often stay at this motel. Don't be fool about some negetive reviews. It is the best location at Sunset Beach and quiet atmosphere that we found all the time.

Summary Heading: this must be where the Hot Tub Time Machine left us!
Summary: This place truly looks stuck in the 80's.  The location is great, although it actually isnt on the beach. And the "ocean view" is more like an ocean glimpse. There are 2 townhouses that sit on the beach. The walkway that separates them is where you get that "ocean view". No joke. This place can definitely use some major upgrading. But for what you'd pay for other motels in the area, its relatively dirt cheap. You get what you pay for, right? And when it came time to sleep, we got in bed to find a nice fat spider that wanted to join us. So ill leave it at this: if you are looking for a cheap place to only shower and sleep, that is close to the beach, this is your place. Otherwise, spend the extra $$.

Don't waste your money.  The rooms at Sanatra are  in disrepair, the furnishings and decorations are shabby, and they actually charge you if you need an extra towel.  In terms of ice, you are charged for that, as well.  Absolutely ridiculous!  Run, run away from this place!

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay - GREAT  Internet
Summary: I would highly recommend the Sanatra Inn.  I found it a very nice place to stay - and kept extending my stay.  The high-speed wifi 802.11g Internet has 3 transmission points and completely covers the entire complex.  Indoor parking, less than 2 block to the beach, nearby stores, etc...  Great location. Friendly and very helpfiul staff.

Summary Heading: Excellent service, fantastic location and superb motel.
Summary: This was a great hotel with no problems or negative things at all.  Staff was very freindly and accomodating.  Rooms were excellent with a good location and  Very close to the beach.  Would always love to refer this motel to anyone and am sure wont regret.

My family was trying to find a hotel near Sunset Beach (walking distance) that wasn't $250+ per night.   The facility is in need of repair and cleaning. We saw dead roaches in the pathways. Fortunately, I never SAW any in the room. The mini fridge in the room didn't work well. The kids watched a little tv in the room right before bed and it was just fine. The beds were comfortable.  The hotel is across a back street from some condos and houses on the beach. We did have a balcony with ocean view and were able to see the water for the most part. I saw some dolphins from the balcony while drinking my coffee in the morning.   If you're expecting anything fancy, this isn't the place for you. But if you are just looking for a place on the beach that will run you a little over a $100,

Be avid travelers, we "thought' we could ride this one out.  But as the night progressed we realized just how wrong we were. This is what we got for $150 (which includes AAA discount):  A filthy upper floor with a large townhouse blocking their "ocean view". The pillowcases smelled, furniture stained, rickety  balcony, and broken "security locks" The refrigerator was old, and a exploded can of cola was left in it.  The vending machines were either broke or empty.  Bring your change with you when getting ice. Location was great: walking distance to beach and restaraunts, but noisy with kids on skateboards, and party people making a ruckus till the wee hours (afterall, this is the beach). Forget about romance: this place is great for frat parties and youngsters to have at it. I

Summary Heading: Best Motel - I will stay again
Summary: My trip was excellent. This motel is just on the beach with great ocean view balconies. Room was cleaned so was the carpet. Bathroom was nice and very clean. Bed was comfortable and I did not find any problem. Someone wrote cockroaches in the room but believe me during my stay of 6 nights I found no roaches or bugs whatsoever. Housekeeping  was good. I used wireless internet which was reliable and fast. I enjoyed my stay at this motel with my husband. If you want to enjoy your vacation go for it. I stay here often and I love this place and the beach.

Summary Heading: dirty place and they have cockroaches
Summary: bed very uncomfortable we were up all night with loud music pounding the wall from the people in the room next to us who we believe live there with all the junk on there patio.the hotel smelled of cockroach spray which one followed us home very sad . i am very dissapointed my kids now have to go through bomb spray in our home due to this problem. im just very sad wish we had slept in our car or drove home it really wasnt worth the money the doors all had gaps in them anyone who would walk by could see in your room.we switched rooms in the beggining because my husband put the credit card in the door crack and it  opened.please be aware of this mess of a hotel it was our first time staying the weekened in a hotel  and now i am frightened to ever do it again.

Staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel has ocean front view and only a stones throw from the beach. Avg sized room, but comfortable and with balcony overlooking beach! Room had mircrowave which was handy. Great place to stop and stay if you are driving down the coast line.

Summary Heading: I will come on and on and stay at this place
Summary: This motel is excellent. Nice comfortable bed. Perfect loacation. Room was cleaned and we had coffee and continental breakfast. Bathroom was cleaned and there is Hot and Cold water 24/hrs. Wireless Internet was fast and smooth. Watch the beach from your bed and surf the web at the same time. Gorgeous view and nice clean motel. We will come here often and stay here since we have noticed, " the motel is well protected by cc cameras at the parking lot as well as at the lobbies."

We had a very uncomfortable night at this hotel.  The bed was rock hard, the mattress had a plastic sheet for a mattress pad and the sheet barely fit and came off during the night.  We could not get hot water in the shower, just lukewarm, and the towels smelled weird and not fresh.  The parking spaces were extremely small.  The relative who made our reservation could not get thru to the motel by phone and had to make our reservation in person.  We felt unsafe - door from lobby to parking garage was open.  And we couldn't complain because we had to pay in advance and leave our keys in the room in the morning.  If there was coffee or breakfast, they didn't tell us about it!   Maybe some of this was because it was off season, but we will not stay there again.  Only good thing was

Sanatra Inn, a perfect and a beautiful experience to have stayed there.  Anyone who mentions it horrible need to change their views because there could be no place as pleasant as Sanatra Inn. The staff is polite, soft spoken and co-operative, the service is quick and the continental breakfast offered is too good. Standing in the balcony and having a view outside makes one feel leisured and homely. The rooms are clean and so are the linens and carpets. The flooring of the motel is good and the interiors as well. And what else could one wish than having a reliable free wireless T1 internet facility which is available everywhere in the motel.      Infact we were hesitating to take a chance since someone had mentioned horrible, but after having stayed there, if anyone asks me where

Summary Heading: It is excellent, we love this place
Summary: It was wonderful trip we had. Sanatrainn Provided beautiful room to us and with clean and neat balcony facing the ocean. TV was big and working in cable mode. Bed was comfortable and capet was new. There we had wi-fi internet reliable connection everywhere in the motel. The lobby was cleaned and the staff was polite. Although Sanatrainn is exactly on PCH we never felt noice. In the morning we had coffee and a cool walk at the green belt. The parking lot was cleaned and under the cover of CC cameras. I will definately recommend this motel to everyone and stay here often when visitng SoCal.

Motels are just like life:  It all depends upon what you want to get out of it, and what you bring to it.  Let me say right up front for those of you in a hurry:  We will DEFINITELY stay at the Sanatra Inn again.  But that said......  THE BAD NEWS The Sanatra Inn on the outside looks like something you might find in Baghdad or some other war-torn third world country.  Here in the USofA we euphemistically refer to it as "deferred maintenance."  WOW!  I haven't ever seen a motel like this on the California coast in my adult life.  In Iraq or The Sudan, it might well be the best one in town.  Lots of rusting hardware, hinges, dilapidated entry doors; an empty pool with bizarre personal belongings, toys, and junk around it.  A couple of old sofas awaiting their final journey to the

This property is terrible:  nothing has been replaced in 15 years, including the linens.  The carpet looks like it hasn't been cleaned in 10 years.  Common areas are dirty, run down and decrepit.  This used to be a neat little place, about 10 or 12 years ago.  Now it is dirty and run down.  Save your money, sleep in your car!  Note:  this was formerly the EconoLodge.
